#summary This page shows the results of Gray Matter on the WAC.EPD test suite.

I do not know the details of the [http://www.jakob.at/steffen/hossa/testsuites/wac.html WAC] test positions yet, but I guess Gray Matter should be able to solve most of these positions within a few seconds. It seems a good test suite to test Gray Matter.

Update: The WAC seems to be “Win At Chess” (Fred Reinfeld), 1958. Moreover, there seems to be a corrected edition wacnew.epd, which I'll use here in the future.

Gray Matter, svn version 1574M, compiled on my HP laptop with Fedora 11,
produced the below results with the command "test tst/wac.epd": 

= Statistics =

There is one success, Gray Matter processed all 300 positions (seemingly) without any errors. Gray Matter was also able to solve 202 of the 300 positions successfully. That is not very impressive, but we will improve it!

{{{
Test Suite statistics
Total successes:          202
Total failures:           98
Total errors:             0
}}}

= Position 2 =

Position 2 is the first one on which Gray Matter fails. There is only one best move and it is Rxb2, while Gray Matter seems to prefer c3.

The extended FEN string is 8/7p/5k2/5p2/p1p2P2/Pr1pPK2/1P1R3P/8 b - - bm Rxb2; id "WAC.002";

This position, however, might be a bit too difficult for our time settings. I verified with Crafty, version 22.9, which only found the move Rxb2 after 8.84 seconds while searching at depth 16!

Crafty says: depth 16 score -2.17 PV Rxb2!! (8.84 seconds)
